meanings.definition: To levy a tax or tribute upon.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to tallage the villagers for their crops.
meanings.sent2: The government tallages its citizens to fund public services.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tallaged the other creatures in the forest for shiny stones.
meanings.sent4: The greedy landlord tallaged the tenants beyond their means.
meanings.sent5: The dragon tallaged the kingdom, demanding gold and jewels as tribute.

meanings.definition: The act of imposing a tax or tribute.
meanings.sent1: The tallaging of goods was a burden on the merchants.
meanings.sent2: The tallaging of the town caused unrest among the residents.
meanings.sent3: The tallaging of sweets at the party left everyone with empty plates.
meanings.sent4: The tallaging of time by the demanding boss made the employees stressed.
meanings.sent5: The tallaging of resources in the drought-stricken region led to scarcity.

meanings.definition: The amount of tax or tribute imposed.
meanings.sent1: The high tallaging on imports affected the economy.
meanings.sent2: The tallaging on the farmers' harvest was excessive.
meanings.sent3: The tallaging on laughter at the comedy show made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The tallaging on dreams by reality can be disheartening.
meanings.sent5: The tallaging on love in the romantic novel added depth to the story.
